Posts.EditableText: I want that when you wake up in a room you hear dull music. When you leafe the building you where in the music should become clearer. Is there anyway to do that?
Posts.HTML: I want that when you wake up in a room you hear dull music. When you leafe the building you where in the music should become clearer. Is there anyway to do that?

Posts.EditableText: You would have to use something like Audacity which has several different effects you can add to music, and then create two versions; one dull and the other clearer.
Posts.HTML: You would have to use something like Audacity which has several different effects you can add to music, and then create two versions; one dull and the other clearer.

Posts.EditableText: You could change volume easily within a program like audacity or acoustica, but you would have to know precisely when a player would leave the room.  Not possible.  The only option I can think of is having two similar (or exact) songs playing.  Upload one that you've slightly muted, and upload a second that you've upped the volume on.  When you leave the room, swap song files.  I know it's not perfect and it will sound like the song started off/changed, but I cannot think of a way to change the volume mid song.
Posts.HTML: You could change volume easily within a program like audacity or acoustica, but you would have to know precisely when a player would leave the room. Not possible. The only option I can think of is having two similar (or exact) songs playing. Upload one that you've slightly muted, and upload a second that you've upped the volume on. When you leave the room, swap song files. I know it's not perfect and it will sound like the song started off/changed, but I cannot think of a way to change the volume mid song.

Posts.EditableText:
This is one of the features I love about Twine. The audio options are very deep. You can set volume, change volume, fade in, fade out, fade out over X seconds, mute, unmute... all with single line scripts.

And in any case, audio is broken in Quest because you can't have two tracks playing simultaneously. I've submitted a ticket to GitHub, but I still don't know if this _is_ a bug, or just a weakness of Quest.
Posts.HTML:
This is one of the features I love about Twine. The audio options are very deep. You can set volume, change volume, fade in, fade out, fade out over X seconds, mute, unmute... all with single line scripts.

And in any case, audio is broken in Quest because you can't have two tracks playing simultaneously. I've submitted a ticket to GitHub, but I still don't know if this is a bug, or just a weakness of Quest.

Posts.EditableText: I thought so. Well I could script it so he would leave the building in a certain amount of time so I could do what XanMag said. But thanks anyway for the answer!
